meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting a pair of optical isomers that are mirror images of each other.
meanings.sent1: The antimeric molecules looked exactly the same when reflected.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the antimeric properties of the compounds.
meanings.sent3: The antimeric twins confused everyone at the costume party.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts and actions seemed antimeric, like two sides of a coin.
meanings.sent5: The concept of antimeric molecules is like seeing your reflection in a mirror.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a molecule that is not superimposable on its mirror image.
meanings.sent1: The antimeric structure of the molecule made it unique.
meanings.sent2: Chemists discussed the antimeric nature of the compound.
meanings.sent3: The antimeric puzzle was challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: His personality was like an antimeric puzzle, always surprising.
meanings.sent5: The idea of antimeric molecules is as puzzling as a maze with no exit.
